intro: Oenothera serrulatoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its medicinal properties due to the presence of essential fatty acids. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Oenothera serrulatoides is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
